senselogic.sitevision.api.node

Interface NodeIteratorUtil


  • @Requireable(value="NodeIteratorUtil")
public interface NodeIteratorUtil
    Node iterator utility interface.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getNodeIteratorUtil(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Detail

      • getFilteredNodeIterator

        NodeIterator getFilteredNodeIterator(NodeIterator aNodeIterator,
                                     Filter<Node> aFilter)
        Gets a filtered NodeIterator.

        This NodeIterator decorates a NodeIterator with a Filter, i.e. it will only return nodes that matches given filter.

        This server-side Javascript example demonstrates how to create a node iterator that is very similar to the MenuItems iterator but this node iterator is not respecting the "visibleInMenus" property. 

            const nodeFilterUtil = require('NodeFilterUtil');
    const nodeIteratorUtil = require('NodeIteratorUtil');
    const startNode = ...

    const filter = nodeFilterUtil.getAnyOfPrimaryNodeTypesFilter([
       'sv:page', 'sv:structurePage', 'sv:article', 'sv:link', 'sv:structureLink', 'sv:collaborationGroupPage'
    ]);
    const nodes = nodeIteratorUtil.getFilteredNodeIterator(startNode.getNodes(), filter);

    while (nodes.hasNext()) {
       let node = nodes.nextNode();
       ...
    }
        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a NodeIterator, must not be null
        aFilter - a Node Filter, must not be null
        Returns:
        a filtered NodeIterator
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aNodeIterator or aFilter is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 8.1
        See Also:
        NodeFilterUtil

      • getNodeIteratorByIdentifier

        NodeIterator getNodeIteratorByIdentifier(String aIdentifier)
        Gets a node iterator via a node identifier.

        The purpose of this method is twofold:

        • Convenience. This method combines ResourceLocatorUtil.getNodeByIdentifier(String) and Node.getNodes(), i.e. a shortcut to get an iterator without having to actually lookup/resolve the parent node.
        • Permission workaround. This method does not do any permission checks on the resolved parent Node, i.e. a shortcut to get an iterator of children where you (potentially) have permission from a parent where you don't.
        Parameters:
        aIdentifier - a node identifier
        Returns:
        a NodeIterator for the sub nodes of the Node resolved via aIdentifier, or null if indeterminable
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.0.2

      • getMenuItems

        NodeIterator getMenuItems(Node aParent)
        Gets an iterator for default menu items (i.e. non-hidden pages, link pages etc. where current user has read permission)
        Parameters:
        aParent - the base node for the iterator
        Returns:
        a NodeIterator for the sub nodes of aParent, or null if indeterminable (i.e. aParent is not a Node in the page tree)

      • getMenuItemsByIdentifier

        NodeIterator getMenuItemsByIdentifier(String aIdentifier)
        Gets an iterator for default menu items via a node identifier.

        The purpose of this method is twofold:

        • Convenience. This method combines ResourceLocatorUtil.getNodeByIdentifier(String) and getMenuItems(Node), i.e. a shortcut to get a menu iterator without having to actually lookup/resolve the parent node.
        • Permission workaround. This method does not do any permission checks on the resolved parent Node, i.e. a shortcut to get an iterator of children where you (potentially) have permission from a parent where you don't.
        Parameters:
        aIdentifier - a node identifier
        Returns:
        a NodeIterator for the sub nodes of the Node resolved via aIdentifier, or null if indeterminable
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.0.2
        See Also:
        getMenuItems(Node)

      • getMenuItemsIncludingFolders

        NodeIterator getMenuItemsIncludingFolders(Node aParent)
        Gets an iterator for default menu items (i.e. getMenuItems(Node)), including folders
        Parameters:
        aParent - the base node for the iterator
        Returns:
        a NodeIterator for the sub nodes of aParent, or null if indeterminable (i.e. aParent is not a Node in the page tree)
        See Also:
        getMenuItems(Node)

      • getMenuItemsIncludingFoldersByIdentifier

        NodeIterator getMenuItemsIncludingFoldersByIdentifier(String aIdentifier)
        Gets an iterator for default menu items (including folders) via a node identifier.

        The purpose of this method is twofold:

        • Convenience. This method combines ResourceLocatorUtil.getNodeByIdentifier(String) and getMenuItemsIncludingFolders(Node), i.e. a shortcut to get a menu iterator without having to actually lookup/resolve the parent node.
        • Permission workaround. This method does not do any permission checks on the resolved parent Node, i.e. a shortcut to get an iterator of children where you (potentially) have permission from a parent where you don't.
        Parameters:
        aIdentifier - a node identifier
        Returns:
        a NodeIterator for the sub nodes of the Node resolved via aIdentifier, or null if indeterminable
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.0.2
        See Also:
        getMenuItemsIncludingFolders(Node)

      • findFirst

        Node findFirst(NodeIterator aNodeIterator,
               Filter<Node> aFilter)
        Gets the first node from a node iterator that matches a specified filter.

        Tip! Use NodeFilterUtil to get an appropriate node filter.

        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a node iterator
        aFilter - a node filter
        Returns:
        first node that matches aFilter, or null. If aFilter is null, the filter will be ignored (all nodes will be accepted). If aNodeIterator is null, null will be returned.
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.2

      • findNodes

        List<Node> findNodes(NodeIterator aNodeIterator,
                     Filter<Node> aFilter,
                     int aLimit)
        Gets a max-sized node list from a node iterator that matches a specified filter.

        Tip! Use NodeFilterUtil to get an appropriate node filter. If the list of nodes should be sorted by a specific property value, you would typically use NodeComparatorUtil to get an appropriate Comparator.

        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a node iterator
        aFilter - a node filter
        aLimit - max number of nodes to include in the result
        Returns:
        a list of nodes that matches aFilter, never null. The list will contain at most aLimit nodes. If aNodeIterator is null, an empty list will be returned. If aFilter is null, the filter will be ignored (all nodes will be accepted). If aLimit is negative or zero, an empty list will be returned.
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.2

      • findMoreNodes

        List<Node> findMoreNodes(NodeIterator aNodeIterator,
                         Filter<Node> aFilter,
                         int aSkip,
                         int aLimit)
        Gets a max-sized node list from a node iterator that matches a specified filter, skipping a specified number of matching nodes.

        Executing findMoreNodes(nodeIterator, filter, 0, 10) is conceptually equivalent to executing findNodes(nodeIterator, filter, 10).

        Tip! Use NodeFilterUtil to get an appropriate node filter.

        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a node iterator
        aFilter - a node filter
        aSkip - number of matching nodes to skip
        aLimit - max number of nodes to include in the result
        Returns:
        a list of nodes that matches aFilter, never null. The list will contain at most aLimit number of nodes and aSkip number of nodes will be ignored. If aNodeIterator is null, an empty list will be returned. If aFilter is null, the filter will be ignored (all nodes will be accepted). If aSkip is negative or zero, no nodes will be skipped. If aLimit is negative or zero, an empty list will be returned.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2025.01.1

      • findAll

        List<Node> findAll(NodeIterator aNodeIterator,
                   Filter<Node> aFilter)
        Gets a list of all nodes from a node iterator that matches a specified filter.

        Executing findAll(nodeIterator, null) is conceptually equivalent to executing toList(nodeIterator).

        Tip! Use NodeFilterUtil to get an appropriate node filter. If the list of nodes should be sorted by a specific property value, you would typically use NodeComparatorUtil to get an appropriate Comparator.

        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a node iterator
        aFilter - a node filter
        Returns:
        a list of nodes that matches aFilter, never null. If aFilter is null, the filter will be ignored (all nodes will be accepted). If aNodeIterator is null, an empty list will be returned.
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.2

      • toList

        List<Node> toList(NodeIterator aNodeIterator)
        Gets a list of all nodes of a node iterator.

        Note! This is a convenience method to use only when you must get nodes as a list! The only apparent reason is when you need need to sort the nodes! If you don't, you should use the NodeIterator instead and do your processing for each node.

        Sorting tip! When the list of nodes should be sorted by a specific property value, you would typically use NodeComparatorUtilto get an appropriate Comparator. The list can then be sorted by Collections.sort(List, Comparator). When using Velocity, you must use the non-static class CollectionsInstance.

        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a node iterator
        Returns:
        a list of all nodes provided by aNodeIterator, never null.
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.2

      • split

        FilterSplit<Node> split(NodeIterator aNodeIterator,
                        Filter<Node> aFilter)
        Gets the filtering result of a split operation for a node iterator with a node filter as divider.

        This method would typically be used instead of findAll(javax.jcr.NodeIterator, senselogic.sitevision.api.base.Filter) when you are also interested in the nodes that does NOT match the filter.

        Note! If aFilter is null, no nodes will match (all nodes gathered via aNodeIterator will be rejected in the resulting filter split).

        Parameters:
        aNodeIterator - a node iterator
        aFilter - a node filter
        Returns:
        the filtering result
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.3
        See Also:
        NodeFilterUtil.split(java.util.Collection, senselogic.sitevision.api.base.Filter)

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
